TrainingDetails.Title: News Archive
TrainingDetails.Abstract: The News Archive is the portal to find and view all your news articles according to their date of publication.
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
This is to show how to make and modify a News Front Page

 

Articles that display on this page reference the Featured News component and the other news component. Reading through this documentation will help you understand the processes and usable functions of the News Front page.

 

 

Required Elements on this page(These elements are needed to save the page): 

  • Title
  • Abstract

Title
The title of the page

Abstract
A summary of the index

SEO Group

Browser Bar Title
Title of the page that will go in the browser bar
No Follow
Search engines will not index the links on this page.
No Index
Search engines will not index the links on this page AND this page will not be either.
NO ODP
This page will not be indexed by the ODP search engine. Please see this link for more information about ODP.
Priority
Please do not adjust this setting

Featured News

This is to add stories to the page. To do so, click select. From the left select the article you want to display.  The click the arrow pointing to the right. If you want to remove and article, select the article from the right and then click the arrow pointing to the left. Click ok when done.

Other News

This is to add stories to the page. To do so, click select. From the left select the article you want to display. The click the arrow pointing to the right. If you want to remove and article, select the article from the right and then click the arrow pointing to the left. Click ok when done.

Related Links
The organization you work for should also have its won related links section. You will need to choose that one.

Publications
This is the location where the article you just created will be published. Please choose the correct indexes.
For example if you work for University Communications you would choose "News and Notes" from the selection.

News

Choose the "News Navigation Component."

Site Control
You will need to choose the site control that is related to your department.
Choose the "News Navigation Component."  This component is required for this page. If it is not selected, the page will NOT render correctly. This element enable the left navigation.
